暴雪回去看看家里灵堂摆没摆好
irrespeto total por parte del publisher a su fanbase.

你说的对 但是《守望先锋2归来》是由动视暴雪自主研发的一款全新第一人称射击游戏。我现在每玩一周守望先锋都能赚60金币，每个月差不多240金币的收入，也就是现实生活中每个月7.2元的收入水平，换算过来31周，也就是7个月，我就可以买一个守望先锋的普通金皮，虽然守望先锋1只要1000金币升级还给箱子可以有几率开出，但是已经超越了中国绝大多数人(包括你)的水平，这便是守望先锋给我的骄傲的资本。ow没有义务给你你想得到的东西，他只是一款游戏,给你带来快乐，还要依着你的小脾气?他就算不让你玩，他也没有不对的地方，记住ow没欠你,也许我们大家还欠暴雪一句谢谢，暴雪花费大量精力和金钱制作的ow2，最后免费开放给玩家，你们居然还不知足，记住是我们选择的ow,不是ow选择的我们，觉得不好可以退游，暴雪、ow不欠我们,但是我们欠暴雪、ow一句谢谢，以及制作组两年多幸苦制作，而不是在这口诛笔伐问官方要补偿，如果你觉得我说的不对，一定是不懂2016夏天的含金量。

No vale la pena, la mera existencia de este juego se debió unica y exclusivamente a la existencia del modo PVP, ahora quieren vender una decima parte de lo que prometieron a full price y haciendose los locos a las demandas de la comunidad, aunque no me sorprende viniendo de una empresa que tiene una cultura laboral toxica y que supongo que el equipo de Overwatch tuvo que sufrir. la neta este juego merece morir y es una lastima porque hasta cierto punto si es agradable de jugar en compañía de amigos pero como producto este no es recomendable, monetización absurda y abusiva. 

Chugu
Su
Muaser
Blizzard.

这个世界不需要守望先锋
想说什么呢，暴雪我吃柠檬，退钱？但我守望1也是白嫖的名额，但我想，青春回不去了，泌阳的暴雪，赤石的晚易，ow的每个英雄故事都会让人动容，没错，这个世界需要英雄，但tm不需要守望先锋：归来，不需要暴雪，更不需要那个当婊子立牌坊的暴毙考迪克！
守望先锋是款好游戏，但暴雪给爷死！

1.你是真不要脸啊，玩家可以不在乎，但是玩家的钱还是要拿。国服说没就没，游戏数据也没了，上线steam吃相难看。

2.游戏平衡了什么东西，让我玩人彘是吧。玩天使机动性被砍，玩路霸钩子被砍，玩艾什衰减高的吓人，秩序之光右键改的什么东西，蓄力1.2秒打那点伤害，就是越改越无聊，就是要把玩家觉得好玩的地方全都改了，还有那个黑影，为了比赛能上场，和一代比那个扩散就是没有了，弹夹又大伤害又高，绕后没有代价，控制减少只要不想死就死不掉。更别说还有改完还改回去的

3.本质上就是防守方高打低，地形有优势。巴黎和月球基地是问题最突出的的，然后要求要团队合作，不合作玩不下去，问题是我要找朋友，要有时间，要有默契，要换掉自己喜欢的英雄去玩这个游戏，要忍受强锁50胜率的匹配，然后我才能可能有游戏体验。

4.战令给的东西非常少，皮肤比一代贵，想要就要就充钱

或者
客服 >> 我想从帐户中移除这款游戏

暴雪、考迪克死一死的话估计无数人在刷了，总要谈点客观的，不然会有些自觉中立的人说点未经他人苦，却劝他人善的风凉话

先说公事：
停更几年，画了N年大饼的守望先锋2就是这玩意？改动还没个版本更新大，这些年员工都在忙什么？办公室性骚扰？看看当年守望2预告CG动画里老玩家的弹幕，现今看来只有2个字：心寒。逼肝骗氪就不说了，反正暴雪现在也就只会这个，我的战役模式呢？信誓旦旦的PVE一拖再拖，张口就是为了玩家更好的体验这些晦涩难懂的词。

再聊私事：
账号承载着老玩家的青春回忆，见证了和朋友一起欢笑犯糗的时光。你说没就没，这就是您说的为了玩家？向钱看嘛，不寒掺，哪怕您站直了脊梁骨，说几句真话，我对您的鄙夷也能少那么几分，来洗的暴白也会多一点。中国玩家不重要，但中国玩家的真金白银很重要。


新玩家的避坑理由
在这里，你能感受到如同上班一样的游玩快感
在这里，你会发现皮肤出的比版本更新更加勤快
在这里，你可以体会到原汁原味的正宗暴雪式傲慢
在这里，你能够看到无数新的承诺簇拥出的艰难决定
在这里，你将游玩一个拒绝中国市场和中国玩家的高贵洋产，玩之前，先低头再折腰。

结语：
暴雪 = 垃圾

I am a high gold D.Va/Reaper/Moira main with 317 hours spread across all the different game modes in Overwatch. I feel like it's fair to say that means I've had the most "average" Overwatch experience, I'm not really anything special but I'm also not a low bronze mongoloid or top 500, 500 pound Widowmaker/Genji/Hanzo main. 

I started playing at the end of season 4 or 5 on a crappy laptop that ran Overwatch 1 at a solid, cinematic 15 frames a second. (I blame my low rank on bad, but well-intentioned advice to try to get a competitive rank before the season ended, despite only having a few days of experience.) Overwatch filled the niche the then-dying Team Fortress left behind, a fun shooter with colorful graphics and a focus on memorable characters. Nothing serious, nothing worth sending death threats to developers or screaming slurs at teammates over.

Overwatch 1 started of strong, steadily introducing more characters and maps, at first, they were a welcome addition to the game, but eventually Blizzard let things fall apart. New characters stopped being based around being "fun to play", their mechanics were very slowly and very steadily warped into "what do we need to add to counter X character in the meta". New maps got worse and worse with every addition, the same handful of chokepoints with a new coat of paint. Existing characters stopped being balanced, Blizzard instead opting to let every match devolve into the same 6 heroes fighting against a set of the same 6 heroes. 

The game just stopped being fun. While there were a few moments to have fun (mostly with friends), it wasn't worth putting up with devs too focused on modifying the game for League, the top 1% of players, OR worth putting up with toxic teammates, screaming and throwing matches over the smallest slights. At this point, most of my friends list had stopped playing the game, and eventually I did too.

Eventually the updates stopped, too, only giving us seasonal events (which introduce good cosmetics, but are ultimately a ploy to get whales to dump money for loot boxes, relying on the fear of missing out), more League events and more League content, and the occasional map. Eventually the seasonal events became recycled from years prior, and the maps slowly stopped being added, with some being removed entirely. I can't say I miss Paris or Horizon much, to be honest.

Trying to salvage the declining players, and easing on the time it took to get into a match, they added role queue, a well-intentioned system that let you opt which character role you wanted to play and removed the ability to switch mid-match. This only increased toxicity and frustration, giving players a greater ability to (rightfully, in some cases) blame their teammates for failure. You can finally blame the Mercy for refusing to heal anyone except the Pharah she's grouped with! You can finally see that you're out-damaging the guy who instantly locked and refuses to switch of Widowmaker!

After months of content drought and lack of transparency from the developers, the Overwatch team announced Overwatch 2! A sequel that was quickly confirmed to just be an update to the game? I remember fans being mixed, some excited, some doubtful, but everyone was united in confusion.

The game was announced to be an engine overhaul, with improved graphics and a new PvE mode featuring talent trees and new exciting gameplay!

Then someone stole breast milk at the Blizzard offices and a scumbag Blizzard employee harassed his coworker to the point of her taking her own life. 

After that bombshell, Blizzard very quickly fell apart. The lead art designers quit, the writing staff quit, the lead designer quit. Overwatch 1 was going to be replaced by 2. The PvE was announced to be removed, then announced to be added back to the game with an additional price tag. The lootbox system was gutted in favor of a predatory cash shop and battlepass. The PvP was a copy/paste job from the first "game" with a small handful of character reworks and rebalancing, and went from a 6v6 game to a 5v5. 

It's really hard to quantify exactly why Overwatch 2 isn't worth playing. It's technically competent, just heavily, deeply flawed. Overwatch 2 is everything wrong with gaming wearing something with a lot of promise and potential as a skin suit.
